eshmun.decisionprocedure

Class Tableau

  • java.lang.Object
    • eshmun.decisionprocedure.Tableau

  • public class Tableau
extends java.lang.Object
    Since:
    0.1 Represents a Tableau of a formula, a tableau has potential models of the formula embedded in it. The tableau has a root, and it is on the form of a directed graph.
    Author:
    Mouhamad Sakr, Kinan Dak Al Bab

    • Method Detail

      • getRoot

        public OrNode getRoot()
        Gets the root of the tableau.
        Returns:
        the root.

      • hasRoot

        public boolean hasRoot()
        Checks if the root has been deleted.
        Returns:
        true if the root has not been deleted, false otherwise.

      • getNoSuccessors

        public java.util.List<TableauNode> getNoSuccessors()
        Returns a list of Nodes with no successors.
        Returns:
        a list of noSuccessors.

      • addNode

        public TableauNode addNode(TableauNode node)
        Add the given node to the tableau, if the node already exist, a pointer for the old node is returned.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to be added.
        Returns:
        a pointer to either the node itself, or a previously equal added node.

      • containsNode

        public boolean containsNode(TableauNode node)
        Checks if the tableau contains the given node.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to check for.
        Returns:
        true if node is already in the tableau, false otherwise.

      • deleteNode

        private void deleteNode(TableauNode node)
        Deletes the given node.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to be deleted.

      • addEdge

        public void addEdge(TableauNode from,
                    TableauNode to)
        Adds an edge between from and to, removes from from the list of nodes with no successors, adds the edge inside from and to as well.
        Parameters:
        from - the node from which the edge starts.
        to - the node in which the edge ends.

      • deletionRules

        public void deletionRules()
        Test this tableau for consistency by deleting inconsistent nodes, applies the deletion rules specified in Emerson and Clarke 82.

        Note that the AF, EF rules are redundant, since expressions are reduced beforehand.

      • DeleteP

        private boolean DeleteP()
        Delete The nodes that contain p with its negation, or false.
        Returns:
        true if the tableau was changed, false otherwise.

      • DeleteOr

        private boolean DeleteOr()
        Delete The OrNodes which all of their successors were deleted.
        Returns:
        true if the tableau was changed, false otherwise.

      • DeleteAND

        private boolean DeleteAND()
        Delete any AndNode that had one child deleted.
        Returns:
        true if the tableau was changed, false otherwise.

      • DeleteAU

        private boolean DeleteAU()
        Delete any node that contain an AUModality and there does not exist a full sub directed graph rooted at that node with the given properties.

        The right child of AU must hold on every node on the frontier of the sub graph.

        The left child of AU must hold on every node in the sub graph that's not on the frontier.

        Returns:
        true if the tableau was changed, false otherwise.

      • DeleteEU

        private boolean DeleteEU()
        Delete any node that contains an EUModality that doesn't satisfy the given properties.

        There exist an AndNode reachable from the node where the right child of EU holds.

        There exist a path to that AndNode from the node where the left child of EU holds in every AndNode on the path.

        Returns:
        true if the tableau was changed, false otherwise.

      • CheckAU

        public boolean CheckAU(TableauNode bNode,
                       AbstractExpression f,
                       AbstractExpression g,
                       java.util.Set<TableauNode> visited)
        Checks if bNode is at the root of a full sub directed graph that satisfies the following properties.

        g must hold on every AndNode on the frontier of the sub graph.

        f must hold on every AndNode in the sub graph that's not on the frontier.

        Parameters:
        bNode - the Node to investigate about.
        f - the formula that has to hold inside the sub graph.
        g - the formula that has to hold at the frontier.
        visited - keeps a set of already visited nodes.
        Returns:
        true if such sub graph was found, false otherwise.

      • CheckEU

        public boolean CheckEU(TableauNode bNode,
                       AbstractExpression f,
                       AbstractExpression g)
        Checks if bNode satisfy the following properties.

        There exist an AndNode reachable from bNode where the g holds.

        There exist a path to that AndNode from the node where the f in every AndNode on the path.

        Parameters:
        bNode - the Node to investigate about.
        f - the formula that has to hold on the path.
        g - the formula that has to hold at the end.
        Returns:
        true if bNode satisfy the properties, false otherwise.

      • getStringDefinition

        public java.lang.String getStringDefinition()
        Outputs the tableau in a format readable by Eshmun.
        Returns:
        the string definition of the tableau.
